Package com.fortify.util.rest.query

This package contains functionality for querying REST API's.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IRequestInitializer
    This interface allows for doing some initialization before AbstractRestConnectionQuery starts loading query results from the REST endpoint.
    IRestConnectionQuery
    This interface allows for querying REST API's.
    IRestConnectionQueryConfigAware<T extends AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder<?,?>>
    This interface can be implemented by IJSONMapPreProcessor implementations to get the current AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder instance injected, allowing to query or update query configuration properties.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractRestConnectionQuery<ResponseType>
    This abstract class provides an implementation for IRestConnectionQuery to allow for querying REST API's.
    AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder<ConnType extends IRestConnection,T extends AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder<ConnType,T>>
    This abstract class allows for configuring an AbstractRestConnectionQuery instance for a specific query.
    PagingData
    This class is used to hold and calculate data related to paging.

Package com.fortify.util.rest.query Description

This package contains functionality for querying REST API's. The main client API for retrieving data is provided by the IRestConnectionQuery interface, for which AbstractRestConnectionQuery provides an abstract implementation. Concrete implementations will need to implement/override some methods to handle paging and processing responses. Clients usually will not instantiate query instances directly, but rather through builders (see below).

The main API for constructing queries is provided through concrete implementations of the AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder class. Based on the builder pattern, these concrete implementations would allow for configuring query criteria, and then building a corresponding IRestConnectionQuery implementation through the build() method.

As an example, suppose we have a system named 'MySystem', which provides query endpoints for books and cards. Usually you would develop a MySystemRestConnectionQuery class that extends from AbstractRestConnectionQuery, and implements the various methods for handling paging and REST responses. You would also have an AbstractMySystemQueryBuilder class that extends from AbstractRestConnectionQueryBuilder, specifies the connection type, and adds a public MySystemRestConnectionQuery build() {return new MySystemRestConnectionQuery(this);} method. This class is then used as a base class for MySystemBooksQueryBuilder and MySystemCardsQueryBuilder. These classes specify the target REST endpoint path, and allow users of your API to configure the queries, for example books search criteria like title, ISBN or author. The implementation for these classes would utilize the functionality provided in the com.fortify.util.rest.webtarget package to configure the corresponding REST query parameters.

Please see the JavaDoc for the various classes for more details.
